meta.videoTitle: How to Prevent & Treat Colds & Flu

proposition: Saunas have long been valued for their ability to promote relaxation and well-being.
Recent research suggests saunas may also play a role in enhancing the immune system.
A study was published in 2023.
The study was titled 'The Effects of Sauna Sessions on the Immune System Response and Heat Shock Protein Levels in Men'.
The study explored the impact of sauna exposure on immune function.
The study focused on both trained and untrained individuals.
The study involved 10 sauna sessions.
Each sauna session consisted of three rounds of 15-minute sessions.
The temperatures during the sauna sessions ranged from 176 to 210 degrees Fahrenheit.
Participants took cool showers in between rounds to cool off.
The research found that sauna sessions resulted in an increase in cortisol levels after the first session.
The research found that sauna sessions resulted in an increase in cortisol levels after the tenth session.
Cortisol is a stress hormone.
Cortisol can stimulate the innate immune system.
The stimulation of cortisol can lead to increased activity of immune cells.
The immune cells are called leukocytes.
The study observed a difference in sauna stimulus response between trained individuals and untrained individuals.
Trained individuals required a stronger sauna stimulus to elicit the same immune response.
Regular exposure to heat, whether through sauna use or exercise, may enhance the body's response to stress and support immune function.
Sauna sessions can provide benefits for the immune system.
It is essential to practice safety and moderation during sauna sessions.
Sauna temperatures should be adjusted based on individual tolerance levels.
Sauna durations should be adjusted based on individual tolerance levels.
Individuals should avoid sauna use if pregnant.
Individuals should avoid sauna use if they have certain medical conditions.
If feeling unwell or experiencing cold or flu symptoms, prioritize rest and recovery over intense heat exposure.
The research on sauna use and immune function highlights the potential benefits of incorporating sauna sessions into a wellness routine.
The impact of heat stress on the body and immune system can help individuals make informed choices to support their overall health and well-being.
